article.headline: SMS 74, Drake 67
article.story:
SPRINGFIELD, Mo. (AP) -- Jenni Lingor scored 19 points as
Southwest Missouri State beat Drake 74-67 on Saturday to win the
Missouri Valley Conference tournament title and earn an automatic
bid to the NCAA tournament.

Meg Tierney added 13 points and 10 rebounds for the Bears
(28-3), who led the third-seeded Bulldogs 39-29 at halftime and
extended the margin to as many 17 points en route to their second
MVC tournament title in as many years.

Linda Sayavongchanh's 16 points led five players in double
figures for foul-troubled Drake (16-14), which had its six-game
winning streak snapped as Southwest Missouri improved to 17-0 at
home.

Southwest led 57-40 midway through the second half before Drake
went on a 12-2 run, closing to 59-52 with about five minutes left.

With just less than a minute left, Erin Dohrmann sank a
3-pointer to cut the lead to 66-62. After two free throws by Kari
Koch, Lingor fouled out on a 3-point attempt by Mandy Kappel, who
converted all three free-throw attempts to pull Drake to within
three at 68-65.

The Bears made all six of their free throws down the stretch to
seal the victory.

Lingor was named the tournament's most outstanding player.

Koch had 18 points -- making all 10 of her free-throw attempts --
for Southwest Missouri.

Dohrmann and Jill Martin added 13 points apiece for Drake.
Whitney Pegram and Allison Burchill added 10 points each.

The Bears started slow, falling behind 5-0 and trailing by as
many as six before Lingor scored two of her 10 first-half points to
tie the score at 14-all with 11 minutes left in the first half.

A little more than a minute later, K.C. Cowgill's 3-pointer put
them ahead 17-14.

Southwest Missouri never trailed after that.

In the first half, the Bears scored 13 points off of the
Bulldogs' 11 turnovers, outscoring Drake 18-8 inside and had nine
steals.

Drake and Southwest Missouri have won 12 of the last 14
conference tournament titles, with the Bears getting eight.
